title: C94-1091

sentences.text: This paper presents an algorithm for selecting an appropriate classifier word for a noun .

In Thai language , it frequently happens that there is fluctuation in the choice of classifier for a given concrete noun , both from the point of view of the whole speech community and individual speakers .
Basically , there is no exact rule for classifier selection .
As far as we can do in the rule-based approach is to give a default rule to pick up a corresponding classifier of each noun .
Registration of classifier for each noun is limited to the type of unit classifier because other types are open due to the meaning of representation .

We propose a corpus-based method -LRB- Biber ,1993 ; Nagao ,1993 ; Smadja ,1993 -RRB- which generates Noun Classifier Associations -LRB- NCA -RRB- to overcome the problems in classifier assignment and semantic construction of noun phrase .
The NCA is created statistically from a large corpus and recomposed under concept hierarchy constraints and frequency of occurrences .

Entity-classifier_for_each_noun.label: classifier for each noun
Entity-classifier_for_each_noun.description: A specific word used to classify and identify nouns in Thai language, with no exact rule governing its selection.

Entity-we_propose_a_corpus-based_method.label: We propose a corpus-based method
Entity-we_propose_a_corpus-based_method.description: A proposed approach that uses a corpus-based method to generate associations between nouns and their corresponding classifiers, aiming to improve classifier assignment and semantic construction in Thai language.

summary: This paper presents an algorithm for selecting an appropriate classifier word for a noun . In Thai language , it frequently happens that there is fluctuation in the choice of classifier for a given concrete noun , both from the point of view of the whole speech community and individual speakers . Basically , there is no exact rule for classifier selection . As far as we can do in the rule-based approach is to give a default rule to pick up a corresponding classifier of each noun . Registration of classifier for each noun is limited to the type of unit classifier because other types are open due to the meaning of representation . We propose a corpus-based method -LRB- Biber ,1993 ; Nagao ,1993 ; Smadja ,1993 -RRB- which generates Noun Classifier Associations -LRB- NCA -RRB- to overcome the problems in classifier assignment and semantic construction of noun phrase . The NCA is created statistically from a large corpus and recomposed under concept hierarchy constraints and frequency of occurrences .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates the act of introducing or offering something (in this case, an idea, concept, or solution), often in a formal or official manner. It implies that the subject has taken on the role of providing or sharing the object with others.

Predicate-happens_that_there_is_fluctuat.label: happens that there is fluctuation in the choice of classifier for a given concrete noun
Predicate-happens_that_there_is_fluctuat.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has an inherent property or tendency to exhibit variability in its use of classifiers when referring to specific types of nouns, which is described by the object. The connection between the subject and object lies in the idea that the subject's linguistic behavior (or a characteristic of it) influences the way classifiers are chosen for concrete nouns.

Predicate-give_a_default_rule_to_pick_up.label: give a default rule to pick up a corresponding classifier of each noun
Predicate-give_a_default_rule_to_pick_up.description: This predicate establishes a connection between a subject (typically an approach or method) and an object (a classification system), indicating that the subject provides default rules for assigning corresponding classifiers to each noun. The predicate highlights how the subject's mechanism or strategy enables the identification of suitable classifiers, which in turn facilitates categorization and organization.

Predicate-is_limited_to.label: is limited to
Predicate-is_limited_to.description: The predicate 'is limited to' indicates a restriction or boundary that applies to the subject. It suggests that the subject is confined within certain parameters, constraints, or categories defined by the object. In general, this predicate establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject's scope, range, or applicability are determined by the characteristics or properties specified in the object.

Predicate-generates.label: generates
Predicate-generates.description: The predicate 'generates' indicates a process of creation or production where the subject (a system, method, or entity) produces or brings into existence the object (an outcome, result, or product). This relationship suggests that the subject has an active role in shaping or generating the object.

Predicate-created_from.label: created from
Predicate-created_from.description: The predicate 'created from' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) has been derived or generated from the object (typically a source material, dataset, or corpus). This relationship suggests an origin or foundation for the subject's existence, meaning, or characteristics.

Predicate-generate.label: generate
Predicate-generate.description: To create or produce something new, often based on existing information or data. The predicate 'generate' indicates a process of creation, formation, or production that results in an object being brought into existence.

Predicate-is_governed_by.label: is governed by
Predicate-is_governed_by.description: The predicate 'is governed by' indicates that there exists an underlying principle or rule that determines the relationship between the subject and object. It suggests a causal link, where the subject's behavior or characteristics are influenced or controlled by the object.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: The predicate 'use' indicates that the subject is employed or put to some purpose or function for achieving an objective. It implies a relationship of application, implementation, or exploitation between the subject and object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a classifier or categorizer of nouns) is related to its object (an algorithm), suggesting that the subject provides a more specific classification or categorization within the scope defined by the object. In general, this predicate establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and object, implying that the subject is a subcategory or specialization of the broader concept represented by the object.
